page.title: 16Firsby Nature Reserve Page 2
page.content: On our walk we saw three families of ducks, they were{mallards.}Two of them started to fight. One got on the others back and bit the others neck and pushed the other right under the water. All the families had ducklings with them. On the reservoir we saw a {coots nest}anchored by the reeds, the mother bird was in the reservoir looking for food. Above us we saw a {lapwing}flying across the sky. Walking along we came across a ranger from {Thrybergh Country Park.}He told us that they were making Firsby reservoir into a Country Park. He said he would come and talk to us at school about it. There is evidence also that{badgers live in the area between Firsby and Ravenfield Ponds and an{avocet}has been seen.
